New Records: The Cavaliers became the 12th team in NBA history to start a season 11-0.
Key Match Events: Garland put the Cavaliers ahead for good at 97-96 with two free throws.
Cam Johnson scored 23 points and Dennis Schroder and Cam Thomas had 22 apiece for the Nets.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers failed to score 110 points for the first time, ending their NBA-record streak of doing so in 10 consecutive wins to open a season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 2015-16 Golden State Warriors hold the league record after winning their first 24 games.
Others: Collin Sexton scored 23 points, Lauri Markkanen added 20 and Utah held off San Antonio, overcoming 24 points, 16 rebounds and seven blocks from Victor Wembanyama.
